conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process of the ideal gas and use the properties of the processes involved.
The cyclic process consists of steps A to B, B to C, C to D, and D to A.
Process A to B is isobaric, work done is W_AB = 1 x 10^5 J.
Process B to C is isochoric, work done is W_BC = 0.
Process C to D is isobaric, work done is W_CD = 0.75 x 10^5 J.
Process D to A is isochoric, work done is W_DA = 0.
Total work done in one cycle is W_total = 1.75 x 10^5 J.
Since the gas returns to its initial state, total work done by the gas is zero.
Work done by the gas from state C to state D is the negative of the work done from state D to state C.
Work done from state D to state C is W_DC = 0.75 x 10^5 J.
Work done by the gas from state C to state D is W_CD = -0.75 x 10^5 J.
